pageContext.claim: “Someone please tell the Radical Left Mayor of Minneapolis that he can’t price out Free Speech. Probably illegal!”
pageContext.analysis: The mayor said it had nothing to do with free speech, but the fact that the Trump campaign is not paying its bills for support services, leaving cities cash-strapped. As of June, at least 10 cities were still waiting on security payments for Trump campaign events, according to the Center for Public Integrity. The largest outstanding payment was for more than $470,000, which El Paso said it was still owed for a February rally. The oldest outstanding payment was for an event held in Burlington, Vt., in January 2016. "As mayor, I have a responsibility to protect free speech, even from a president whose rhetoric and policies I find reprehensible," Mayor Jacob Frey wrote in the The Washington Post. "However, it is not my responsibility to subsidize it.}
